Become a Leader in Natural Health Care
Create your best life by helping others do the same. Since 1935, Logan University has been preparing future generations of holistic health care leaders. Start your journey here.
Choose from seven degree programs and a variety of electives and clinical opportunities. Chart your own path to a rewarding career in natural health care.

Many Paths to a Rewarding Future
As one of the most affordable chiropractic colleges in the country, Logan is committed to providing the financial options to make quality health care education a reality.
Logan welcomes transfer students into all of our undergraduate, graduate and doctoral degree programs.

Logan is proud to host students from throughout the country and around the world. Our International Admissions Coordinators will ensure that your application process and transition to the U.S. go smoothly.

If you're looking to accelerate your education, Logan offers a number of programs for undergrad, graduate and high school learners, including Early College Credit Program, our 3 3 Program and the Flexible Accelerated Science Track (FAST).

In addition to our Military Scholarships, Logan participates in the Post-9/11 GI Bill Program, and we are certified to offer Yellow Ribbon benefits providing 100% tuition coverage for eligible students.
Our New Student Orientation will prepare you for college success with a comprehensive overview of all aspects of life at Logan.
Our expert admissions team is ready to help you take the next step in your educational journey. Don't hesitate to reach out with any questions you may have.
To secure your spot in our next trimester, submit your deposit using our secure online form, or call Logan Admissions at 800-533-9210.

Begin your chiropractic career a year sooner, and save on tuition. Our 3 3 Program allows you to earn a bachelor's degree through one of our partner universities while beginning your DC program at Logan.
From team sports to Greek organizations to various chiropractic technique clubs, more than 30 student groups provide numerous opportunities to learn, lead and make lasting connections.
Two dining facilities, the Logan Café and Charlie's Grab N' Go, offer healthy and hearty options for breakfast and lunch.

From the Chiro Games to intramural competition, Logan offers a variety of ways to stay active, including athletic fields, basketball, volleyball and tennis courts, an 18-hole disc golf course and a fully-equipped Wellness Center.
To help you get settled near campus, Logan Admissions can assist in finding local housing and other students seeking roommates.
From our beautiful campus in Chesterfield, MO, you're just minutes away from the outstanding dining, arts, entertainment and nightlife St. Louis has to offer.
Logan is committed to providing a high-quality education at a great value. All of our programs are competitively priced, allowing graduates to embark on their careers with small student loans.

Current College of Chiropractic and College of Health Sciences students can take advantage of a variety of endowed scholarships. The Office of Financial Aid can help you find additional external scholarship opportunities.
Loans, work-study opportunities and federal and state grants can open the door to even more financial support options for students enrolled part-time or more.
How do I apply to Logan?

To secure your spot, please secure your tuition deposit after applying. Fees are $300 for the Doctor of Chiropractic program, $100 for Master’s and Doctorate of Health Professions Education and $50 for our Bachelor’s degree programs.
DOCTOR OF CHIROPRACTIC: WHAT TO KNOW WHEN YOU APPLY
If you have any questions, please contact the Office of Admissions by phone 800-533-9210, by email
The application must be completed in full. Application review for each academic term occurs on a rolling basis. A
is due at the time of application and can be paid online as part of the application process.

Applicants are required to request and submit official academic transcripts from all colleges and/or universities attended. Transcripts should be sent to: Logan University Office of Admissions 1851 Schoettler Rd. Chesterfield, MO 63017

Applicants are required to submit a one to two-page, double spaced, typed Statement of Motivation summarizing the reasons for pursuing a Doctor of Chiropractic degree from Logan University. The Statement of Motivation should also include goals following graduation.
Applicants are required to obtain a letter of recommendation or completed Logan Reference Form completed by a licensed Doctor of Chiropractic. Download the form and email it to

. Please contact the Office of Admissions if you are unable to obtain a recommendation from a licensed Doctor of Chiropractic. If preferred, a clinician interview can be scheduled during a Campus Visit tour.

International students may be required to submit transcripts to an outside evaluating agency if transcripts are not transcribed in English or are based on a different education system than that of the United States. International students must submit proof of English proficiency, unless they have earned a degree in the United States or English is their first language. To verify English proficiency, students are required to earn a satisfactory score on either the internet-based TOEFL or the paper-based TOEFL. International students, outside of Canadian citizens, will be required to obtain an F-1 visa for study. All students are recommended to have a valid passport.

Students who do not meet the academic requirements, but would like to be considered for the Doctor of Chiropractic program may need to complete the following steps: A personal statement as to why you believe you will be successful in the program and an interview with an Office of Admissions representative.
GRADUATE DEGREES: WHAT TO KNOW WHEN YOU APPLY
BACHELOR'S DEGREES: WHAT TO KNOW WHEN YOU APPLY
Application for the Flexible Accelerated Science Track (FAST) program is separate from the application for the Doctor of Chiropractic degree.

Students applying for a bachelor’s degree must have earned a high school diploma or equivalent. Applicants must have earned at least a 2.0 GPA on a 4.0 scale. Applicants must submit their high school transcript, unless they have taken 24 or more credit hours from an accredited college or university. See transfer of credit policies and procedures for details.

Applicants are required to request and submit official academic transcripts from all colleges and/or universities attended. Transcripts should be sent to: Logan University, Office of Admissions, 1851 Schoettler Road, Chesterfield, MO 63017.

Learn to Serve in All New Ways
Military service matters at Logan University. Students who have served with the armed forces can take advantage of several aid programs.

Before using VA benefits at Logan, all veterans and dependents must provide documentation of eligibility. For veterans, this documentation includes your DD-214 and a certificate of eligibility. For dependents, a certificate of eligibility and the Department of Defense authorization for transferred benefits is required. If you have applied for benefits to the VA but have not yet received a certificate of eligibility, please provide a copy of your full application to the certifying official. Student veterans can manage their benefits, and check the status of the benefit claims at

Student veterans must complete a veteran benefit registration form for each trimester you wish to receive benefits. This will initially be sent to you by the certifying official after proof of eligibility has been submitted. It will subsequently be sent via email to all returning veterans and dependents when registration opens for the next trimester.
If you are a new student veteran or an eligible dependent who has never used VA education benefits and would like to apply, submit your application online at
Any student veteran who previously received VA education benefits (other than vocational rehabilitation) at another school must complete a change of program or place of training form.

Logan University proudly participates in the Yellow Ribbon Program. Awards are made to qualified applicants for all degree programs. Logan University will fund 50% of the remaining unmet tuition and fees charges. However, please note that the amount each student receives will vary according to the cost of their degree program and any tuition-specific scholarships or grants that they may have been awarded. It cannot exceed the maximum contracted amount of $10,000. The Yellow Ribbon Program award cannot be combined with other Logan awards to result in a tuition surplus.
• Be admitted as a degree-seeking student with net tuition and fee charges above the Veteran Affairs’ annual maximum rate as posted at
• Be eligible for CH. 33 Post-9/11 G.I. Bill education benefits at the 100% level
• Maintain good academic standing at Logan University
• Provide proof of eligibility to Logan’s certifying official

Student veterans who have been selected for the Yellow Ribbon Award will receive funding each year they remain in their current program of study as long as the University continues to renew its agreement with the VA. Logan has the right to reduce awards or discontinue the Yellow Ribbon Program at the end of each academic year. Yellow Ribbon contributions will not be adjusted after the last day to drop classes without a W assigned, typically the end of the second week of classes. Any costs accrued due to adding or dropping classes after that date each trimester will be the student veteran’s responsibility.

Note: On request, Logan University may be required to show proof of academic progress to the VA. Logan does not require prior approval from the student veteran to maintain compliance with VA regulations.
The certifying official will collaborate with the VA to closely monitor your enrollment status and academic program. Student veterans have the following responsibilities:
• Notify the certifying official every time you want to be certified by completing the veteran benefits registration form.
• Register only for courses required by your selected degree.
• Do not register for courses you have already successfully completed with a passing grade or credit even if it was taken at another university.
• Maintain satisfactory progress toward your degree.
• Notify the certifying official if you change programs, add or drop a class, withdraw from classes, change address or deplete your VA educational benefits.

Chart your path to a rewarding career in natural health care.
See what makes Logan the leader in health science education.
The journey to a rewarding career in chiropractic or the health sciences begins with a visit. Logan offers a variety of ways to experience our dynamic campus community for yourself.

Are you a potential transfer student, incoming freshman or aspiring Doctor of Chiropractic? Get an in-person taste of life at Logan with one of our weekly tours, Future Leopard Weekends, high school programs or schedule your own visit. And, see for yourself why MSNBC listed our 112-acre campus as one of America’s Most Beautiful.

Students interested in our Doctor of Chiropractic program are invited to participate in Logan’s formal Campus Visit program held frequently throughout the school year. Tour campus, get an introduction to anatomy and experience a typical day at Logan. If you’re interested in our College of Health Sciences programs, contact Admissions to schedule your visit.

Discover what it’s like to be a Doctor of Chiropractic student at one of the world’s leading health science universities. Held three times a year, Future Leopard Weekend is our largest event for prospective DC students. Tour campus and our state-of-the-art labs, experience a mock adjusting session and talk with students and faculty.

Learn about health, wellness and anatomy, and gain hands-on lab experience in Logan’s popular, one-week summer program. Developed exclusively for high school students, the Anatomy Centered Education & Science (ACES) program offers an exciting introduction to the life sciences and health care fields.

Explore the structures and systems of the human body with a guided tour of Logan’s advanced human anatomy lab. Offered in sessions appropriate for both health and science students as well as interested community members, our Tour of the Body is offered at no cost to the community.

Conveniently located near the City of St. Louis, Logan University offers easy access to a variety of places to stay. For prospective DC students visiting from outside the St. Louis area, we are happy to provide a complimentary night at the Drury Plaza Hotel–Chesterfield. You’ll also find special short and long-term rates at the nearby Hampton Inn and Suites Chesterfield, the Hampton Inn Chesterfield and the Sonesta ES Suites St. Louis–Chesterfield.
Take a virtual tour of Logan’s 112-acre campus. View the labs, Student Center, Health Center, classrooms and learn a bit about Logan history in this 360-degree online tour.
